00040 class PropertyValue: public ValueReference
00041 {
00042     bool m_needed;
00043 public:
00051     template<typename T> PropertyValue( const T &ref, bool _needed = false ):
00052         ValueReference( new Value<T>( ref ) ), m_needed( _needed ) {
00053         checkType<T>();
00054     }
00055     template<typename T> PropertyValue( const Value<T>& ref, bool _needed = false ):
00056         ValueReference( new Value<T>( ref ) ), m_needed( _needed ) {
00057         checkType<T>();
00058     }
00064     PropertyValue( bool _needed = false );
00066     bool &needed();
00068     bool isNeeded ()const;
00069 
00078     bool operator ==( const PropertyValue &second )const;
00088     bool operator !=( const PropertyValue &second )const;
00096     bool operator ==( const _internal::ValueBase &second )const;
00108     template<typename T> bool operator ==( const T &second )const {
00109         checkType<T>();
00110 
00111         if ( get()->is<T>() ) { // If I'm of the same type as the comparator
00112             const T &cmp = get()->castTo<T>();
00113             return second == cmp; //compare our values
00114         } else if ( ! isEmpty() ) { // otherwise try to make me T and compare that
00115             LOG( Debug, info )
00116                     << *this << " is not " << Value<T>::staticName() << " trying to convert.";
00117             ValueReference dst = ( *this )->copyToNewByID( Value<T>::staticID );
00118 
00119             if ( !dst.isEmpty() )
00120                 return dst->castTo<T>() == second;
00121         }
00122 
00123         return false;
00124     }
00125 };
